core:process.core:name: GetTenderAmountMain
core:process.core:comment:
Generic tender amount prompt process. Generally expects Pos/Tender/TestPreAmountRestrictions to have been called first to set up values and Pos/Tender/TestPostAmountRestrictions to be called afterwards.
Input fields are (mostly very badly named):
BalanceTenderValue - the basket balance due to be paid, normally the full balance due but can be limited if partial tendering a split bill. In tender currency.
BalanceValue - same as BalanceTenderValue but in base currency.
LimitedTenderValue - the basket balance due to be paid but limited if appropriate to the maximum amount that can be paid with this tender type, i.e. limited by applicable tenders, return tenders restrictions. In tender currency.
LimitedValue - same as LimitedTenderValue but in base currency.
PayableTenderValue - the maximum amount that can be paid with this tender, as determined by the tender itself, e.g. the balance remaining on a gift card or account. In tender currency.
MessageText - if supplied, the actual text to use for the prompt, otherwise a message is determined from other values.
FormattedBalanceTenderValue - same as BalanceTenderValue but formatted as a string in the tender currency.
FormattedLimitedTenderValue - same as LimitedTenderValue but formatted as a string in the tender currency.
TenderValueLimited - fairly pointless flag which means LimitedTenderValue is not equal to BalanceTenderValue.
TenderAmount - the amount to be paid with this tender if known - if set there will be no prompt and this will be used as the tender amount, unless it exceeds limits.
EnteredTenderAmount - the amount as a string pre-entered before entering tendering - if set there will be no prompt and this will be used as the tender amount, unless it exceeds limits.
IsRefund - this tender is a refund.
ReturnOriginalTenderDetail - present if we are returning an original tender.

core:assignAction.core:comment: Forced tender amount means the payable value becomes the limited balance.
If the payable tender value is not supplied it becomes the basket limited balance due. Limit the payable value to the limited balance.

core:dataAssignment.fromExpression: notEmpty(payableTenderValue) && payableTenderValue > 0 && payableTenderValue <= limitedTenderValue ? payableTenderValue : limitedTenderValue

core:action.core:comment: Raise a foreign currency tender seleected information event for the benefit of the customer display.
Raise a foreign currency tender seleected information event for the benefit of the customer display.
Test the absolute maximum that can be paid with this tender.

core:outcomeLink.core:condition: notEmpty(process.maxPayableTenderValue) && process.maxPayableTenderValue != 0 && ( (process.tenderItem.foreignAmount == 0 && process.tenderItem.tenderAmount > process.maxPayableTenderValue + process.surcharge) || (process.tenderItem.foreignAmount != 0 && process.tenderItem.foreignAmount > process.maxPayableTenderValue + process.surcharge) )

core:executeProcessAction.core:comment: Calculate any srucharge to be applied to this tender
If a surcharge is applicable and they entered a tender amount less than the amount due, recalculate the surcharge component.

core:dataAssignment.fromExpression: notEmpty(limitedValue) && limitedValue != 0 && limitedValue < balanceValue ? limitedValue : balanceValue

core:action.core:name: Validate Amount
core:action.core:comment: Vallidates the amount and sets it on the tender item

core:outcomeLink.core:comment: If payable tender value is supplied as an input, this means the absolute maximum that can be paid with this tender.

core:action.core:comment: Convert the tender amount due in base currency to DCC currency. We use rounding rule up for both tender and refund to be fair and avoid awkward refund situations.

core:eventLink.core:condition: (process.tender.surchargeAmount != 0 || process.tender.surchargeRate != 0 || (notEmpty(process.paymentCardType) && (process.paymentCardType.surchargeAmount != 0 || process.paymentCardType.surchargeRate != 0))) && notEmpty(state.tenderAmount) && state.tenderAmount < state.payableTenderValue + process.surcharge
